alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Greene; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 10:07PM EDT until April 01 at 6:30AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Elliston...to Hazleton. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the White River at Elliston to all points downstream. Moderate flooding has ended at Edwardsport...but will be starting at Petersburg tonight...and continue along the lower White River through Sunday. The crest on the White River will continue along the Knox...Daviess County line through Friday. Flooding will likely last through this Friday along Greene County portions of the White River...and through next week for the lowest portions of the White River. Rain going into this weekend may extend flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Elliston. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.5 feet, County Road 100 N leading to Shawnee Field floods. High water affecting other roads near the White River in Greene County also. Extensive flooding of river bottomlands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 23.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM EDT Wednesday was 23.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Friday evening and continue falling to 9.2 feet Saturday, April 08. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by noon Thursday.
